original_title: China firm to install smart meters for 50,000 Sri Lanka electricity consumers
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – China-based Yantai Dongfang Wisdom Electric Co. Ltd had won a bid to install smart meters targeting 50,000 Sri Lanka electricity customers, a statement said.
The firm was selected following an international competitive bidding process for which there were five responses.
The cabinet of ministers had approved the award of the contract for 937.1 million rupees. The project was estimated to cost one billion rupees.
Yantai Dongfang Wisdom Electric Co will be responsible for planning, supply, installation and inspection of the smart meters, in Dehiwala, a suburb of Sri Lanka’s capital Colombo.
State -run Ceylon Electricity Board first had installed 1,000 smart meters in the Katunayake area under a pilot project funded by the Asian Development Bank according to the agency’s annual report.
In December 2020 another project to install 13,000 smat meters was initiated in the Katuntayake. (Colombo/ April09/2023)
